name: Olive Garden Country Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009
reviews.text: Our stay at the Olive Garden Country Lodge was one of the best week-end away's that I have had. The hospitality was fantastic - nothing was to much of an effort.
reviews.title: Out of this World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our hosts were great - made us feel that we belonged.
reviews.title: Quiet, comfortable stop on R62 with excellent food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was modern and very comfortable with a fireplace which was great on those cold evenings.
reviews.title: A Gem in Robertson - A Must Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food was to die for. I have never in my life had food that good and what I liked was that if you could not eat what they were serving they would change to your food choice and make you something special.
reviews.title: PARADISE IN ROBERTSON

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will recommend this lodge to all.
reviews.title: Rest your soul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beauty of the Robertson mountains and the smell of fynbos combined with the hospitality and friendliness of Gina and Fernand made our engagement weekend at Olive Garden unforgettable. It is definitely a destination that I will recommend to all who enjoy quality food, beautiful and cosy rooms/cottages but most of all the serenity of raw nature which is also cherished by both Gina and Fernand.
reviews.title: What an underscovered jewel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fendand took us for a tour through his olive oil making process, we went mountain biking and hiking, enjoyed fabulous food and wine and also the cosiness of a fire place in our room.
reviews.title: A wonderful peace of earth.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am looking forward to my next trip to the Olive Garden
reviews.title: Charming luxury lodge with wonderful hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at Olive Garden Country Lodge. It was definetly one of our highlights during our holidays in South Africa. Ferdinand was a wonderful host and pampered us the best way possible to make our stay comfortable. We can recommend Olive Garden Country Lodge to all appreciating a wonderful landscape, very nice accomodations and especially to all loving good wine and food. Thank you very much.
reviews.title: Didn't think that a rural stay could be this luxurious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although Gina and Fernand were not there (dentist appointment in Cape Town) we were met and attended to by Terry who settled us in. As soon as Gina arrived she came to our room with a welcoming glass of wine and snacks. She immediately made us feel right at home and was very helpful in organizing our activities for our two night stay. The guest house has a lovely setting in a surrounding olive grove. Gina and Fernand produce an excellent olive oil there. The rooms were clean and well appointed. My husband enjoyed the hiking path up the mountain directly from their property. The best part was the food. The breakfast was a gourmet delight with all the trimmings. We ate dinner there both nights. Fernand is a wonderful cook and Gina made sure that we had a delightful time. Since the menu is limited I am sure that if you let them know ahead of time of any dietary restraints they would be more than willing to accommodate you. Very relaxing time. We hope to return on our next trip to South Africa.
reviews.title: A really special and unique place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Olive Garden Country Lodge is very, very good but what makes it exceptional is the passion that both Gina and Fernand put into everything they do. We have absolutely no hesitation in recommending it as a very peaceful place to stay.
reviews.title: Very Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights as our choice for the "luxury" part of our week trekking in the area and were not disappointed. There is no need to explore anywhere else for food (as my partner says "you are remiss if you go anywhere else"), when you have Ferdinand to cook meals for you! We thoroughly enjoyed every meal that we had - even breakfast is a gastronomic delight - looking over the gardens and nearby mountains. Both Gina and Ferdinand are very attentive hosts, but do not overwhelm you, and their Belgian heritage brings a continental feel to their exquisite cooking. We enjoyed their wine paring choices with our 3-course dinner, that was superb, and filled you perfectly. As South Africans ourselves, we loved their passion for our country, and commitment to caring for the earth through organic farming and care for the land.
reviews.title: Exceptional food, beautiful views, fantastic hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were treated to the "honeymoon" cottage, and even thought most of the decor is not our taste, it was comfortable, spacious and all the extras provided. We liked the bathroom with its stone clad walls, and fantastic large bath with jets. The bed was large and had percale linen. The little patio outside was private and provided beautiful views of the surrounding farm, well tended gardens, and backed by the mountains of the area.
reviews.title: Superb escape within striking distance of Cape Town!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When it rained, Gina brought us an umbrella to the cottage. When we talked about going for a walk, we were given walking sticks. When we asked about olive farming, all the details were explained, even down to how they are choosing their packaging. When we asked what we could do in our short visit, we were introduced to local spots to visit and support.
reviews.title: a find with delightful hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you enjoy walking or hiking this is the spot for you. And, if you enjoy just being lazy, take your pick of hanging out by the exclusive little swimming pool, or indulging in a jacuzzi, or finding a spot in the pretty gardens with a blanket and your favourite book - all the while enjoying the bray of a distant donkey, or moo from the local cows.
reviews.title: Rural Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful scenery, fabulous views. We unfortunately only had one night here, wished we could have stayed longer. Room was in the pretty gardens and was private, comfortable clean and spacious with a shaded verandah to relax on after a days sightseeing. Welcoming drinks and nibbles served on our verandah by our hosts at 7pm - a lovely thing to do. Great dinner and breakfast too. We would love to come back to this peaceful place again.
reviews.title: A little piece of heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The personal attention at Olive Garden was what stood out for me this weekend. The hosts are very friendly and accommodating; one could really see they wanted us to enjoy ourselves. The setting is beautiful and quiet, ideal for a romantic weekend away. Swimming pool, jacuzzi, hiking trail etc. all contribute to this being a very special place.
reviews.title: Fantastic setting. Very personal service, good value, will definitely go again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Thanks Gina and Fernand!
reviews.title: Don't stay here - stay around the corner at Fraai Uitzicht

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The couple were very unfriendly and unwelcoming. We arrived just after midday and were made to feel very uncomfortable about 'arriving so early'. Views massively disappointing, rooms comfortable with good facilities but decor odd (ie western-style swing doors to bathroom so you can see/hear your mate on the loo while in the room). Also very expensive for the facilities and smelt of dog poo. Went for supper around the corner at Fraai Uitzicht where the host was charming, location much better and we were welcomed warmly and given delicious food.
reviews.title: If you are looking for an escape with ambience and good food this is it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009
reviews.text: Extremely pleasant stay, the atmosphere is very relaxed and the rooms are more than comfortable with everything you need. The hosts are really geared to ensure that you feel welcome from the first moment you arrive with very personal service and excellent food.
reviews.title: A truly wonderful stay!

description: This luxury accommodation is a fine Boutique hotel on a large Olive Estate surrounded by olive trees in the most secret valley out of Robertson Klaasvoogd West completely sheltered from the Langeberg.Nature at his best –Tranquility-Enjoy. The plentiful use of natural materials from the estate set the tone and ambience, mesmerizing even the most lavish guest!!! Attention to detail fulfill all expectations. Warm, earthly hues, soft fabrics ,Egyptian cotton and stylish comfortable furnishings set the tone for a relaxing stay.All rooms have equally breathtaking and frontal mountain and views from their balconies. From here, the spectacular view over the valley is exceptional. A real Tuscan feeling “Far Niente” or doing nothing.
